lines.content: The **Architecture Design** given above explains the high-level design of the App.
Given below is a quick overview of each component. </br>
`Modman` is the main class of the application, and handles the app launch,
initializing the appropriate classes to be used. </br>
The rest of the app consists of four components:
**How the four architecture components interact with each other and the ModMan class**
The *Sequence diagram* below shows the interaction between components for when the user issues the command `add module CS2113T`
The sections below give more details of each component.
1. The `Parser` class is used to parse the user command.
2. This returns a `Command` object which is executed in `Modman`.
3. The command execution can affect the state of other components e.g. the sort command changes the order of assignments in `Module`.
4. The `Command` object can also instruct the `Ui` to list and display information to the user.
Given below is the Sequence Diagram for creating the corresponding `Command` object from user input via `Parser`. </br>
The sequence diagram also acts as a reference frame for `getCommand`.
Given below is the Sequence Diagram for the Storage class. The storage class interacts with the database file, storing our data into the database or loading our data from the database. </br>
1. The `Storage` class is used to interact with the database.txt file by calling loadData() at the start of the program and calling saveData() at the end of the program.
2. The `Storage` class will collect the data of all classes that implements the Storable interface so that these data can be saved to the database.
3. The `toStorage()` method of the Storable interface will return a string representing the object instance's data.
4. This string will then be appended to the database.txt file.
* stores an `ArrayList` of `Module` objects that represents the modules.
* Each `Module` object contains `ArrayLists` of `Assignment`, `Lesson`, and `Student` objects.
Given below is the sequence diagram for the sort assignments by deadline command.
Given below is an example usage scenario and how the sorting mechanism behaves.
Step 1. The user launches the application. The CS2113T module has an assignment quiz1 due on 17 Aug 2021.
Step 2. The user adds 2 more assignments quiz2 and quiz3
Step 3. The user only sets the deadline for quiz3 to be 16 Aug 2021.
Step 4. The user executes `sort by deadline` which reorders the assignments in CS2113T to be quiz3, quiz1 and quiz2.
Assignments with null as deadline are sorted behind assignments with deadlines.
* have a need to manage their module(s), students and assignments
Just to keep track of all informaiton pertaining to a module teaching assistants (at NUS) have to make use of multiple platforms:

With the help of ModMan, users will be able to add, edit, and store all information on one platform, simplifying the process. In addition, features such as autograding and saving comments for assignments will free up time, allowing TAs to focus on teaching!
|Version| As a ... | I want to ... | So that I can ...|
|v1.0|new user|see usage instructions|refer to them when I forget how to use the application|
|v2.0|user|find a to-do item by name|locate a to-do without having to go through the entire list|
1. The application should work on any *mainstream* operating system (e.g. Windows, Linux, macOS)
1. The application should be responsive and users should not face any sluggish performance.
1. Users who are above average in typing speed (in English) should be able to easily issue commands faster than using a mouse.
{Give instructions on how to do a manual product testing e.g., how to load sample data to be used for testing}
ModMan, short for Module Manager, is a desktop app designed to help teaching assistants manage their module(s).

It is optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI). Mod Man helps to track module details as well as studentsâ€™ progress and data, all in one platform. It can also perform autograding for MCQ assignments.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` installed on your computer.
1. Open a command window in the folder containing the `.jar` file.

1. Run the command `java -jar {filename}.jar`
If you haven't changed the filename, run the command `java -jar ModMan.jar`
| :information_source: | Inputs in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by the user. |
Adds a new module to the list of modules.
I have added a new module: CS2113T
Removes a module from the list of modules.
You have successfully removed module: CS2113T
Select the module you want to currently work in.
Success! You are now working in: CS2113T
View the current module you are working in.
You are currently working in: CS2113T
Assigns a new student to the current module you have selected.
> Expected outcome (assuming the current module is "CS2113T") :
I have assigned a new student to CS2113T:
> Expected Outcome (assuming the current module is "CS2040C") :
I have added a new assignment to CS2040C:
Adds a new lesson to the list (timetable) of lessons for the module you have selected.
Format: `add timetable /t TYPE /v VENUE /d DAY /s START_TIME /e END_TIME`
* The `TYPE`, `VENUE` and `DAY` can be in a natural language format.
* The `START_TIME` and `END_TIME` must be in the format `HHmm` eg. `1800`.
Success! I have added the following timetable for the module - CS2113T
### vii. Listing Students Details: `list student details`
Lists the details of all students enrolled in a particular module.
Here are the students of all students enrolled in CS2113T:
### ix. Listing Students in Module: `list student `
Lists the names of students assigned to the current module you have selected.
> Expected outcome (assuming the current module is "CS2113T") :
Here are the students in CS2113T:
Lists the lessons in the timetable for the module you have selected.
* The `START_TIME` and `END_TIME` will be listed in the format `HH:mm` eg. `18:00`.
Here are the lessons in CS2113T:
Lists out all assignments in the module along with the due date if the deadline was set.
Here are the assignments in CS2113T:
Sorts all assignments in the module by their deadline.
If no deadline was set, the assignment will be sorted after those with deadlines.
Here are the assignments in CS2113T:
### xiii. Editing an Assignment Name: `edit assignment`
Edits the assignment name of an existing assignment
`edit assignment /t mcq /a Magic Sequence /n Forest Fruits`
I have updated your assignment name:
Sets the deadline the assignment has to be graded by.
If a deadline had previously been set, it will be updated by the new deadline.
The DEADLINE must be in the format dd MM yyyy eg. 16 08 2021.
Here are the assignments in CS2113T:
Lists the students' grades for a particular assignment.
The students listed are sorted by grades.
Here are the students' grades for the quiz1 assignment:
Auto-grades all student scripts for a particular assignment by comparing against solutions.
Automatically updates student's grades for that assignment.
Here are the students' grades for the quiz1 assignment:
**Q**: How do I delete a particular module/assignment?
**A**: The feature of deletion is still in progress and will be released in our upcoming versions.

add module | `add module MODULE_NAME`
e.g. `add module CS2113T`

remove module | `remove module MODULE_NAME`
e.g. `remove module CS2113T`

add student | `add student /s STUDENT_NAME /# STUDENT_NUMBER /e STUDENT_EMAIL`
e.g. `add student /s John Doe /# A0123456Y /e e0123456@u.nus.edu`

add assignment | `add assignment /t TYPE_OF_ASSIGNMENT /a ASSIGNMENT_NAME`
e.g. `add assignment /t mcq /a Magic Sequence`

add timetable | `add timetable /t TYPE /v VENUE /d DAY /s START_TIME /e END_TIME`
e.g. `add timetable /t Lecture /v Zoom /d Fri /s 1600 /e 1800`

list student details | `list student details MODULE_NAME`
e.g. `list student details CS2113T`

list student | `list student`
e.g. `list student` assuming current module is : CS2113T

sort assignments | `sort by deadline`
e.g. `sort by deadline`

edit assignment | `edit assignment /t TYPE_OF_ASSIGNMENT /a OLD_ASSIGNMENT_NAME /n NEW_ASSIGNMENT_NAME`
e.g. `edit assignment /t mcq /a Magic Sequence /n Forest Fruits`

set deadline | `set deadline /a ASSIGNMENT_NAME /d DEADLINE`
e.g. `set deadline /a quiz1 /d 17 08 2021`

list grades | `list student assignment grades /a ASSIGNMENT_NAME`
e.g. `list student assignment grades /a quiz1`
